text: Hi all, please find here <https://gerrit.hyperledger.org/r/#/c/2243/> a proposal for identity provider interface. Any feedback would be welcome!
<@U1BC5A0F9> - be careful what you ask for!   :wink:
Should i have just remained silent? :zipper_mouth_face: :smiley:
hehe
i can't help anymore - this system has exceeded my complexity threshold
<@U0XR6J961> do you think the Identity Provider is too complex?
no, i think fabric is too complex
and not properly layered
and overengineered
i.e. it's an "enterprise" product
<@U0ZR63HLK> - I'm working on my comments for the IDP
thanks a lot :slightly_smiling_face:
<@U0XR6J961>, do you have specific comments regarding the security part of the fabric? I would be interested on hearing that :slightly_smiling_face:
no i don't, because fabric exceeds my complexity threshold
come on, to improve we need your comments
do you have specific points in mind?
and that whole channel+reconfig for new channels thing is just so stupid
which aspect, the combination of channels and PBFT?
no, the fact that there are channels
as a solution to address confidentiality or what?
yes
and at all
so what's your alternative suggestion?
the whole point of a blockchain is a shared data base
run separate chains instead of channels
if you really need it
that can be already done, no? But if you have a use-case that requires sharing the ordering service with v1 you will be able to have it, no?
<@U0XR6J961> - I guess somewhere along the way you missed the fact that in the end what people want is not actually the traditional definition of a blockchain.
faster horse carriages, etc.
now perhaps the alternative would be to create multiple "consensus" groups within the peer to peer communication - that was an alternative
modify endorsement to actually be consensus among small groups
right now it sounds like a pub sub service
a trusted pub sub service
<@U0N4P17ND|oiakovlev> has joined the channel

QQ: in v1 we'll have plug-able certificate authority but if Customer needs some custom encryption mechanism will it be possible or not really? This is the question from the bank and it occurs that central authority might not be ok, with SHA3, for example but provides something different...
Hi <@U0N4P17ND>, that is definitively a goal  that we are pursuing. That's the reason why the BCCSP has been introduced
<@U0ZR63HLK> so just to make clear - is it on roadmap for v1 for next year?
<@U0PB67X4K> can tell you more on this :slightly_smiling_face:
Dumb question, what does BCCSP stand for?
Blockchain Crypto Service Provider?
yes :slightly_smiling_face:
Great, whenever I see "CC" in an acronym it makes me think 'chaincode' ala VSCC ESCC etc., wanted to make sure
